channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two drains are blocked and are spilling sewage onto the walk path, 31st October
item.description:
This has been spilling for about a week, this is causing sewage to spill onto the walk path in front of homes. The spill covers the width of the path so you have no choice but to walk through it which is very unhygienic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Twigg Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bump outside of 63 Haverstock Hill, 31st October
item.description:
As you know, bike lanes are being added to Haverstock Hill. As part of that process, the workers added a speed bump to a pedestrian crossing right across from 63 Haverstock Hill. Every time a bus or lorry crosses that bump, there is a strong vibration that can be felt in our building and in neighboring buildings. Please remove this speed bump, or smooth it out and add large signage so taht large vehicle know to slow down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Haverstock Hill, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes in wrong bay, 31st October
item.description:
These Limes bikes are left in a resident only parking bay and are now beginning to overflow on to double yellow lines. It’s always Lime riders. They always abuse the rules with no consequences. Please do something about this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Church Row, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
